lexUnit.name: grunt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a low, short guttural sound.

sentence.text: “ No , ” he grunted .
` Yes , " Bragg grunted .
` Pity she could n't do the same for you , " Freddy grunted .
` Huh ! " he grunted disbelievingly .
Well , you ca n't afford to at this age , " Jack grunted .
` Not a chance , man ! " grunted Ewan , heaving a spearsman left-handed over a wall .
` You 've caught me on a bad day , " grunts Graeme Souness , as he ambles across the mahogany lined reception at Ibrox .
` If he 's the alternative , " grunted the Hungarian , ` you 're the better bet . "
` Well , I hope we are going to find a bit more life than this , " grunted Billy , as they sat down at a table near the gas fire .
` Better get off , " grunted Selwyn , ` our Molly will 'ave me dinner on . "
` It 's a boy , " grunted Billy , after careful observation .
` Sounds neurotic , " grunted Mitchell .
` Hmm , " grunted Paul Lexington .
` Work ! " grunted Orrin , unkind for once about the niece he loved .
` Just as I foretold ! " grunted the crusty old gentleman .
The relieved Prince grunted an acknowledgement , then leaned forward to gaze critically in the mirror .
She grunts her displeasure .
Wei Feng grunted his dissatisfaction , but Wang Hsien , T'ang of Africa , was not so restrained .
We passed the police sentry who grunted a sleepy greeting .
Yanto grunted some inaudible remark and was introducing her to a goggle-eyed Billy as Nigger joined them .
She grunted a reply and offered coffee .
In fact , he grunted something complimentary about it being dashed public-spirited of me to come back so soon .
He grunted something unintelligible and poked a sausage savagely .
` I 'm a DK , lady , " he said to Defries , grunting the words as he struggled to keep his footing on the juddering floor .
` Hang on , " he grunted to Antony and clambered quickly to the top .
Tom grunted in the affirmative .
` And how 's his nibs this morning ? " she grunted in her slightly Cockney voice .
He climbed up the steps , pipe in mouth , grunted out a few words as he entered the attic and blew the lamp out , plunging them all into total darkness .
